intro: Sida subdensiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered sida, is an herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, pinkish to white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Sida subdensiflora is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
